page.title: 02A child's day in Roehampton
page.content: 7.30 get dressed slowly,trudge downstairs and breakfast on Coco Pops and a cup of milk.8.30 set off for school and my mother goes off to work. I go straight into church where the service is taken by the Vicar.Then we have Maths. After play we have rounders at the playing field.12 noon, sunny and dry so we play on the grassy common.My favourite game is 40/40 where one person is on 'it' and the rest have to get to the solid object before the person on it sees them coming.1.00, eat my packed lunch in the hall.After 2 more lessons school finishes at 4.00, I am collected by my au pair.After homework,tea and reading comics, my mother comes home around 6.30. I make her a whisky and soda. We watch television and eat dinner.8.50 I get ready for bed.9.15 after saying prayers I turn out the light. Clarissa,aged 10.
